title: technical looking font
content:
Hi Guys,

Interested to know what typeface the "RVLTN" part of this logo is in?

It might be custom designed, any help would be appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041520im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rvltn_3722.gif)
author: reverb

comments.content: Great stuff! :^D The R has some problems, but what a fun logo! The typeface (if it isn't a custom job) might be a freeware one. Did you check the techno section on DaFont?

I guess the name is supposed to suggest <cite>revolution</cite>, but the first thing that popped into my head was <cite>revoltin'</cite>.

Nice logo, though.

There once was an Image Club font called East Bloc that resembled this constructivist style, but I think Yves is right -- custom or freebie.

- Mike Yanega

Whaddaya know, FontHaus is now selling all the Image Club fonts. Here is [East Bloc Closed](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041520/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/MI415591). There is an alternate version and two equivalent lined versions.

[edit: hmmm, I guess they are getting them from Monotype, which also has this font. For some reason I thought Monotype had offloaded the Image Club fonts after having them for a while. Apparently they just decided they didn't need to be the exclusive vendors.]

- Mike Yanega
